Jewell Jones - State Representative
May 13 at 5:32 PM ¬∑

The COVID-19 crisis has elicited a strong response from government, private, and nonprofit agencies to ensure that their communities have access to food. This response has demonstrated strengths and weaknesses in the food system that were existing before the crisis and were exacerbated by the pandemic as well as creating new challenges. In response, the National Kidney Foundation of Michigan and Beaumont Healthy Communities are hosting a food system listening session for Western Wayne County. The goal of the meeting is to learn about what it‚Äôs like for residents to access and prepare the foods they want and need for themselves and their families in Western Wayne County. We hope that by learning about challenges, desires, and what‚Äôs working well, we can come together to create strategies to make a strong, resilient food system for everyone, such as creating a food policy council. The listening session will be held on Thursday, May 28 from 8:30-10:00 am.

To qualify for Comcast‚Äôs Internet Essentials service, customers must be eligible for public-assistance programs such as the National School Lunch Program, Housing Assistance, Medicaid, SNAP, or SSI. Applicants can visit internetessentials.com to enroll in the program; they may also call (855) 846-8376 for English or 855-765-6995 for Spanish.
